name: Zone
comment: A Zone represents the asynchronous version of a dynamic extent. Asynchronous callbacks are executed in the zone they have been queued in. For example, the callback of a future.then is executed in the same zone as the one where the then was invoked.

ROOT.name: ROOT
ROOT.comment: The root zone that is implicitly created.

parent.name: parent
parent.comment:
Returns the parent zone.

Returns null if this is the dart-async.Zone.ROOT zone.

[].comment:
Retrieves the zone-value associated with dart-async.Zone.[].key.

If this zone does not contain the value looks up the same key in the parent zone. If the dart-async.Zone.[].key is not found returns null.

Any object can be used as key, as long as it has compatible operator == and hashCode implementations. By controlling access to the key, a zone can grant or deny access to the zone value.

inSameErrorZone.name: inSameErrorZone
inSameErrorZone.comment:
Returns true if this and dart-async.Zone.inSameErrorZone.otherZone are in the same error zone.

Two zones are in the same error zone if they share the same dart-async.Zone.handleUncaughtError callback.

fork.name: fork
fork.comment:
Creates a new zone as a child of this.

The new zone will have behavior like the current zone, except where overridden by functions in dart-async.Zone.fork.specification.

The new zone will have the same stored values (accessed through operator []) as this zone, but updated with the keys and values in dart-async.Zone.fork.zoneValues. If a key is in both this zone's values and in zoneValues, the new zone will use the value from zoneValues`.

run.name: run
run.comment: Executes the given function dart-async.Zone.run.f in this zone.

runUnary.name: runUnary
runUnary.comment: Executes the given callback dart-async.Zone.runUnary.f with argument dart-async.Zone.runUnary.arg in this zone.

runBinary.name: runBinary
runBinary.comment: Executes the given callback dart-async.Zone.runBinary.f with argument dart-async.Zone.runBinary.arg1 and dart-async.Zone.runBinary.arg2 in this zone.

runGuarded.name: runGuarded
runGuarded.comment:
Executes the given function dart-async.Zone.runGuarded.f in this zone.

Same as dart-async.Zone.run but catches uncaught errors and gives them to dart-async.Zone.handleUncaughtError.

runUnaryGuarded.name: runUnaryGuarded
runUnaryGuarded.comment:
Executes the given callback dart-async.Zone.runUnaryGuarded.f in this zone.

Same as dart-async.Zone.runUnary but catches uncaught errors and gives them to dart-async.Zone.handleUncaughtError.

runBinaryGuarded.name: runBinaryGuarded
runBinaryGuarded.comment:
Executes the given callback dart-async.Zone.runBinaryGuarded.f in this zone.

Same as dart-async.Zone.runBinary but catches uncaught errors and gives them to dart-async.Zone.handleUncaughtError.

registerCallback.name: registerCallback
registerCallback.comment:
Registers the given callback in this zone.

It is good practice to register asynchronous or delayed callbacks before invoking dart-async.Zone.run. This gives the zone a chance to wrap the callback and to store information with the callback. For example, a zone may decide to store the stack trace (at the time of the registration) with the callback.

Returns a potentially new callback that should be used in place of the given dart-async.Zone.registerCallback.callback.

registerUnaryCallback.name: registerUnaryCallback
registerUnaryCallback.comment:
Registers the given callback in this zone.

Similar to dart-async.Zone.registerCallback but with a unary callback.

registerBinaryCallback.name: registerBinaryCallback
registerBinaryCallback.comment:
Registers the given callback in this zone.

Similar to dart-async.Zone.registerCallback but with a unary callback.

bindCallback.name: bindCallback
bindCallback.comment:
Equivalent to:

 ZoneCallback registered = registerCallback(f);
 if (runGuarded) return () => this.runGuarded(registered);
 return () => this.run(registered);

bindUnaryCallback.name: bindUnaryCallback
bindUnaryCallback.comment:
Equivalent to:

 ZoneCallback registered = registerUnaryCallback(f);
 if (runGuarded) return (arg) => this.runUnaryGuarded(registered, arg);
 return (arg) => thin.runUnary(registered, arg);

bindBinaryCallback.name: bindBinaryCallback
bindBinaryCallback.comment:
Equivalent to:

 ZoneCallback registered = registerBinaryCallback(f);
 if (runGuarded) {
   return (arg1, arg2) => this.runBinaryGuarded(registered, arg);
 }
 return (arg1, arg2) => thin.runBinary(registered, arg1, arg2);

createTimer.name: createTimer
createTimer.comment: Creates a Timer where the callback is executed in this zone.

createPeriodicTimer.name: createPeriodicTimer
createPeriodicTimer.comment: Creates a periodic Timer where the callback is executed in this zone.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-async.Zone.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and dart-async.Zone.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the dart-async.Zone.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-async.Zone.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-async.Zone.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-async.Zone.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-async.Zone.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
